back_cards.example_en: Flowers were blooming everywhere in the garden.
News of the event spread everywhere.
She looked everywhere for her lost keys.
Smartphones are used everywhere now.
The kids were running everywhere at the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Money given for goods or services
back_cards.example_en: She made a payment for the car.
Payment must be completed by Friday.
The monthly payment was affordable.
His payment was delayed due to an error.
The store accepts online payment.
The meeting concluded with a vote.
They concluded that the plan was feasible.
She concluded her speech with a quote.
He concluded the problem was technical.
The teams concluded the deal successfully.
She screamed when she saw the spider.
The crowd screamed during the concert.
The brakes screamed as the car stopped.
He screamed in frustration at the delay.
The bright colors screamed for notice.
The surgery repaired her broken leg.
The hospital’s surgery was fully equipped.
He specialized in heart surgery.
The injury required urgent surgery.
The surgery lasted three hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A dark shape cast by light
back_cards.example_en: The tree’s shadow stretched across the lawn.
There was a shadow of doubt in her mind.
The dog was his shadow everywhere.
A shadow hung over the celebration.
They rested in the shadow of the hill.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who sees an event
back_cards.example_en: The witness described the accident.
The witness was sworn in before speaking.
The document was a witness to their agreement.
She was a witness to the signing.

back_cards.definition_en: A person present at an event
back_cards.example_en: The witness saw the theft occur.

back_cards.definition_en: To a greater degree over time
back_cards.example_en: It’s increasingly difficult to find parking.
She became increasingly confident in her role.
The issue is increasingly common.
The costs are increasingly high.
He spoke increasingly louder to be heard.

back_cards.definition_en: The front part of the torso
back_cards.example_en: He felt a pain in his chest.
The chest held old family photos.
She wore a medal on her chest.
The pirate’s chest was full of gold.
The doctor listened to his chest.

back_cards.definition_en: A change to a legal document
back_cards.example_en: The amendment altered the law.
The First Amendment protects free speech.
The amendment fixed the contract.
The amendment was debated in Congress.
The club voted on a new amendment.
She chose blue paint for the walls.
The paint on the house was peeling.
He used oil paint for the portrait.
The fence needed fresh paint.
The car’s paint gleamed in the sun.
She complained about the cold food.
He complained to the manager.
They complained about the long wait.
He always complains about traffic.
She complained about unfair treatment.

back_cards.definition_en: The degree or scope of something
back_cards.example_en: The extent of the damage was severe.
To what extent are you prepared?
The extent of the forest was vast.
Her skills improved to a great extent.
The policy’s extent affected many.
Reading is her greatest pleasure.
It was a pleasure to meet you.
She took pleasure in gardening.
The concert was a real pleasure.
He found pleasure in simple things.

back_cards.definition_en: To move the head to agree
back_cards.example_en: She nodded in approval.
He nodded when I explained.
The teacher nodded to start the test.
They nodded to greet each other.
She nodded as she listened.

back_cards.definition_en: A day of celebration or rest
back_cards.example_en: Christmas is a major holiday.
They went on a holiday to the beach.
The office is closed for the holiday.
The holiday brought the family together.
She needed a holiday to relax.
The party was super fun.
They stayed at a super hotel.
He bought a super big TV.
Her performance was super.
The super fast car won the race.
Her talent for singing was evident.
The young talent joined the team.
He has a talent for fixing things.
Her artistic talent amazed everyone.
The show discovered new talent.

back_cards.definition_en: As a certain or inevitable result
back_cards.example_en: Expensive doesn’t necessarily mean better.
The plan won’t necessarily succeed.
Big cities aren’t necessarily safe.
He’s rich, but not necessarily happy.
You don’t necessarily need a degree.
She has liberal views on education.
He gave a liberal amount of time.
Her liberal mindset welcomed change.
The liberal candidate spoke tonight.
He took a liberal approach to parenting.
Her expectation was to finish early.
The job exceeded her expectations.
The team met the project’s expectations.
He had high expectations for the trip.
Societal expectations shaped her choices.
She accused him of stealing her idea.
They accused the team of cheating.
He was accused of breaking the rules.
She accused her friend of lying.
The prosecutor accused him in court.

back_cards.definition_en: To strike a door or surface
back_cards.example_en: She knocked on the door twice.
He knocked the glass off the table.
Don’t knock her efforts; she tried.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a sound by hitting
back_cards.example_en: The engine knocked loudly.
She knocked into the chair.
She previously worked as a teacher.
The issue was previously discussed.
He previously owned a small shop.
The rules were previously unclear.
Previously, the area was rural.
The bird spread its wing to fly.
The plane’s wing was inspected.
The hospital’s east wing was new.
The party’s left wing proposed changes.
The team took wing to the finals.
The corporation opened a new branch.
The corporation was sued for damages.
She works for a tech corporation.
The corporation funded the project.
The corporation paid hefty taxes.
The tech sector is growing rapidly.
The sector was secured by police.
She works in the public sector.
The private sector funded the event.
The energy sector faced challenges.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance in food or body
back_cards.example_en: The recipe used healthy fat.
He worked to reduce body fat.
The pan was coated with fat.
They lived off the fat of the land.
Butter is a type of fat.
The experiment tested a new theory.
The recipe was an experiment.
Her experiment proved the hypothesis.
The design was an experiment in style.
The experiment yielded surprising results.
The soccer match was thrilling.
They were a perfect match.
He lit the fire with a match.
Her skills were a match for his.
The colors were a good match.
The thin paper tore easily.
She wore a thin jacket in spring.
The crowd was thin at the event.
His excuse was pretty thin.
The soup was too thin.
The farmer planted corn this season.
The farmer fed the chickens daily.
The farmer sold produce at the market.
The farmer owned vast fields.
The farmer used organic methods.
A rare bird visited the garden.
Her talent is rare and special.
The book was a rare find.
The rare coin was worth a fortune.
He ordered his steak rare.
Her confidence shone during the speech.
He had confidence in the plan.
She spoke with great confidence.
His confidence grew with experience.
She told him in confidence.
She picked a bunch of flowers.
He bought a bunch of bananas.
A bunch of friends came over.
The keys were in a bunch.
They were a fun bunch to hang out with.
He bet on the winning horse.
I bet she’ll arrive early.
They bet their savings on the business.
I bet it’ll rain this afternoon.
She bet ten dollars on the game.
She cited a study in her paper.
He cited her as an inspiration.
The court cited him for contempt.
The book cited several authors.
She cited the rule they broke.
The northern lights were stunning.
The northern region was cold.
She loved northern cuisine.
The northern slope was steep.
The northern dialect was distinct.
The speaker captivated the audience.
The speaker played loud music.
The Speaker of the House presided.
The keynote speaker was inspiring.
She’s a confident speaker in meetings.
The doctor examined her breast for lumps.
The bird puffed out its breast.
The statue depicted a mother’s breast.
He pinned a medal to his breast.
Hope stirred in her breast.
Her contribution to the project was vital.
He made a contribution to the charity.
His ideas were a major contribution.
The contribution of teamwork was clear.
Each member’s contribution was equal.

back_cards.definition_en: A flat part of a plant
back_cards.example_en: The leaf turned red in autumn.
She turned the leaf of the novel.
The table had a leaf extension.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a plant’s structure
back_cards.example_en: The leaf was covered in dew.
The new leaf marked spring’s arrival.
Her creative designs won awards.
He had a creative solution to the problem.
The creative team launched a new campaign.
Her writing was highly creative.
The chef’s creative dishes were unique.
Their interaction was friendly and open.
The interaction between chemicals caused a reaction.
The app encourages social interaction.
The teacher’s interaction with students was warm.
The interaction improved their teamwork.
She wore a wide-brimmed hat.
The worker’s hard hat was bright yellow.
His hat matched his suit perfectly.
She wore many hats at the company.
The hat shielded her from the sun.
There’s no doubt he’ll succeed.
She had doubt about the plan.
His skills left no room for doubt.
The claim raised doubt among experts.
Doubt lingered after the debate.
The police pursued the suspect.
She pursued her dream of acting.
He pursued the project despite challenges.
They pursued new business opportunities.
She pursued her studies abroad.

back_cards.definition_en: In general or as a whole
back_cards.example_en: Overall, the event was a success.
The team performed well overall.
Overall, the changes were positive.
The feedback was overall favorable.
Overall, she was satisfied with the results.
The nurse checked her blood pressure.
The nurse worked the night shift.
He became a nurse after years of study.
The nurse comforted the patient.
The nurse administered the medication.

back_cards.definition_en: Lasting or affecting a long period
back_cards.example_en: They made a long-term investment.
Her long-term goal was to retire early.
The project had long-term benefits.
Long-term care was arranged for him.
The policy aimed for long-term growth.
The loud music didn’t bother her while studying.

back_cards.definition_en: To take the effort to do something
back_cards.example_en: He didn’t bother to check the schedule.
Sorry to bother you, but I have a question.
The news bothered him more than he admitted.
Don’t bother the kids while they’re playing.
The court found her guilty of fraud.
He felt guilty for missing the meeting.
The company was guilty of false advertising.
Her guilty look betrayed her secret.
They were guilty of ignoring the rules.
